handling daily media inquiries
maintaining relationships with national and local reporters
writing talking points and press releases
pitching op-eds
managing website
producing videos and social media content
planning and pitching press events in DC and the district
overseeing daily clips
keeping press lists up-to-date

strong writing and oral communication skills
the ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
a good sense of humor

key_responsibilities: creating digital content such as graphics, videos and ads
drafting social media posts and statements
working with House Franking to get materials approved

attention to detail
follow through

ability to multi-task
an even temperament

key_responsibilities: acting as the representative for the Member
answering casework correspondence
meeting with constituents
serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
screening and referring cases to other district offices
preparing reports for the District Director on pending cases
assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action
making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
requirements: highly organized
detail-oriented
friendly
strong written and verbal communication skills in both English and a second language
Strong analytical skills
ability to work independently and as part of a team
empathetic
ability to actively listen
problem-solve
comfortable documenting casework progression in a database
minimum of 3-5 years of case work experience for a Member of Congress

key_responsibilities: handling of substantive legislative and administrative tasks
staffing hearings and markups
conducting oversight
drafting legislation
requirements: minimum of 2-4 years of experience in the House of Representatives
strong writing, analytical, and legislative skills
sound political judgment
proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks with competing priorities
willingness to work long hours and weekends
experience working with relevant public interest groups, relevant agencies, Congress, and industry

key_responsibilities: preparing the Member’s daily and monthly schedules
briefing the Member on all scheduling activities and requests of the Washington, DC and district offices
managing all of the Member’s travel and lodging reservations
maintaining the Member’s files and correspondence
requirements: work well under pressure
willing to work a flexible schedule that includes non-traditional work hours
at least three to five years of related work experience including prior scheduling and professional office experience

key_responsibilities: overseeing all operations of the district offices
development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
direct all activities and staff of the district offices
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensuring that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
representing the Member and/or assigning appropriate staff to do so at events or functions through the district as needed
strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents
casework management
serving as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
acting as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region
requirements: minimum of 3-5 years of management experience
strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process
energetic
detail-oriented
able to multi-task
politically astute
willing to work long hours (including evenings and weekends) in a fast-paced and demanding setting

key_responsibilities: draft legislation
analyze bills
meet with constituents concerning policy matters
requirements: libertarian or classical liberal
strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, the Rule of Law, and the Constitution
excellent writer and clear thinker
JD or equivalent
Two years of relevant policy experience

writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials

Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment
